Module ru.ifmo.rain.terentev.implementor
Package ru.ifmo.rain.terentev.implementor

Class Implementor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.ifmo.rain.terentev.implementor.Implementor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Impler, JarImpler
    public class Implementor
extends java.lang.Object
implements JarImpler
    Class gives ability to user to
    • create .java files implementations of classes and interfaces
    • compile implementations and pack compiled .class into Jar-archives
    See Also:
    implement(Class, Path), implementJar(Class, Path)

    • Method Detail

      • implement

        public void implement​(java.lang.Class<?> aClass,
                      java.nio.file.Path path)
               throws ImplerException
        Gets class or interface to implement and generates source code for class, implementing it.
        Output file is created in subdirectory of the given path. The resulting class is located in a package, whose name coincides with the name of the package, in which the given-user class is located.
        Specified by:
        implement in interface Impler
        Parameters:
        aClass - type token to create implementation for.
        path - root directory.
        Throws:
        ImplerException - if the given class cannot be generated as:
        • Some arguments are null
        • Given class is primitive or final or array or Enum.
        • Given class is not an interface and contains only private constructors.
        • The problems with I/O occurred during implementation.

      • getAbstractMethods

        private java.lang.String getAbstractMethods​(java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
        Represents String,which contains implementation of abstract methods of given Class
        Parameters:
        aClass - given class to implement abstract methods

      • getAbstractMethods

        private static void getAbstractMethods​(java.lang.reflect.Method[] methods,
                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Method> storage)
        Takes array of Method and add only declared as abstract of them to Set, which is second argument
        Parameters:
        methods - given array of Method
        storage - Set storing methods

      • getConstructors

        private java.lang.String getConstructors​(java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
                                  throws ImplerException
        Represents String,which contains implementation of constructors of given Class
        Parameters:
        aClass - given class to implement constructors
        Throws:
        ImplerException - if class doesn't have any non-private constructors

      • getExecutable

        private java.lang.String getExecutable​(java.lang.reflect.Executable exec)
        Returns String, which represents fully constructed Executable, which includes returning default value of return type of such Method or calling constructor of super class if argument is Constructor
        Parameters:
        exec - Method or Constructor to process
        Returns:
        String representing code of such Executable

        Parameters:

      • implementJar

        public void implementJar​(java.lang.Class<?> aClass,
                         java.nio.file.Path jarFilePath)
                  throws ImplerException
        Produces .jar file implementing class or interface. Method gets class or interface to implement and generates .jar-archive, containing class, implementing it. .jar-file contains compiled public class, implementing given class or interface,which was suffix Impl in classnam.
        Specified by:
        implementJar in interface JarImpler
        Parameters:
        aClass - class or interface to implement
        jarFilePath - specified location of generated .jar
        Throws:
        ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method starts implementation, depending on amount of arguments from command line. There are two legal variants of arguments:
        • className rootPath - runs implement(Class, Path) with second and third arguments
        • -jar className jarPath - runs implementJar(Class, Path) with second and third arguments
        Parameters:
        args - arguments for running program

      • getClassPath

        private static java.lang.String getClassPath​(java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
        This method finds classpath
